question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What institution did Steven J White attend in 2005?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
Here is a narrative that weaves in detailed evidence to support the claim that Steven J White attended Massachusetts Institute of Technology:

---

The sun was setting over the Charles River, casting a warm orange glow over the bustling campus of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) in Cambridge, Massachusetts. It was a crisp autumn evening in 1985, and Steven J White, a bright-eyed and ambitious young scholar, was walking towards the iconic Building 10, the heart of MIT's academic hub. As he strolled through the campus, he couldn't help but feel a sense of pride and accomplishment, knowing that he was about to embark on a journey that would shape his future. Steven, a native of Massachusetts, had always been fascinated by the world of science and technology. Growing up, he spent countless hours tinkering with gadgets and machinery, trying to understand the intricacies of how things worked. His curiosity and passion for learning led him to apply to MIT, one of the world's most prestigious institutions for science and engineering. After a rigorous application process, Steven received the news he had been waiting for â€“ he was accepted into MIT's Class of 1989. Overjoyed and relieved, he knew that this was just the beginning of an incredible adventure. As he settled into his dorm room in McCormick Hall, Steven was struck by the diversity and talent of his fellow students. He was surrounded by individuals from all corners of the globe, each with their own unique story and motivation for pursuing higher education. The sense of community and camaraderie was palpable, and Steven knew that he had made the right decision in choosing MIT. Throughout his undergraduate years, Steven immersed himself in a wide range of courses, from physics and mathematics to computer science and engineering. He was particularly drawn to the works of MIT's renowned faculty, including Professor Noam Chomsky, a pioneer in linguistics and cognitive science. Steven's academic pursuits were complemented by his involvement in various extracurricular activities, including the MIT Robotics Club and the Student Union. One of the most significant experiences during Steven's time at MIT was his participation in the Undergraduate Research Opportunities Program (UROP). This initiative allowed him to work closely with faculty members on cutting-edge research projects, providing him with invaluable hands-on experience and exposure to the latest advancements in his field.
content.source_2: In the sweltering summer of 2029, Steven J White stepped onto the sun-kissed campus of Maastricht University, his heart racing with excitement as he embarked on a new chapter of his academic journey. The Faculty of Health, Medicine and Life Sciences, with its sleek, modern architecture and bustling corridors, was to be his home for the next two years. As he settled into his dormitory, Steven couldn't help but feel a sense of pride and accomplishment. He had worked tirelessly to earn a spot in this prestigious program, and now, he was ready to dive headfirst into the world of cutting-edge research and innovation. The first few weeks were a whirlwind of orientation, introductions, and getting accustomed to the rigorous academic schedule. Steven quickly found his footing, however, and soon became an integral part of the faculty's vibrant community. He spent long hours in the state-of-the-art laboratories, pouring over research papers, and collaborating with his peers on groundbreaking projects. As the months flew by, Steven's passion for his work only grew stronger. He became particularly fascinated with the emerging field of personalized medicine, and spent countless hours studying the latest advancements in genetic engineering and gene therapy. His dedication did not go unnoticed, and soon, he found himself working closely with some of the leading experts in the field. The summer of 2030 brought with it a sense of routine, as Steven settled into his second year at the faculty. He had established a tight-knit circle of friends, and together, they explored the charming city of Maastricht, discovering hidden gems and making memories that would last a lifetime. As the autumn of 2031 approached, Steven's thoughts turned to the future. He had grown and learned so much during his time at the faculty, but he knew that it was time to take the next step. With a sense of nostalgia washing over him, he began to wrap up his projects, and prepare for the next chapter of his journey. On a crisp November morning in 2031, Steven J White walked out of the Faculty of Health, Medicine and Life Sciences for the last time, his heart full of gratitude and his mind buzzing with excitement for the adventures that lay ahead.
